name: stepwise
content:
stepwise adjective
(IN STAGES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
happening or changing in a series of regular stages: I took a stepwise approach, figuring out the problem first, then searching for possible solutions.
More examplesFewer examplesThe method involves the use of a cooling device for stepwise decrease of the temperature. Oxygen flow was adjusted in a stepwise fashion to decrease the oxygen content from 21% to 16% to 12% to 8%. His drift away from the religion of his birth was stepwise and slow.

stepwise adjective
(MUSIC)
music
  specialized used to describe a change from a musical note to the note that is next to it in a scale (= a series of notes): The theme of Elgar's Enigma Variations is greatly enhanced by the stepwise movement of the bass. the stepwise motion from C to D
More examplesFewer examplesSince stepwise movement is common in most types of music, the practising of scales forms a basic part of an instrumentalist's training.The tenor part proceeds mostly in stepwise motion.The song's stepwise melody is deceptively complex.In common with Part's other music, it has stepwise modulations and an emphasis on cyclic, thematic repetition.
